hanzi-su-wiki:
懇

Значения

Добрый, сердечный, тёплый

Мнемоника

Обращать взор 艮 к земле и рыхлить её, как свинья (заменено похожим знаком 豸). Сердце 心 пахаря не агрессивно.

Варианты

恳
purpleculture_pinyin:
kěn
earnest
серьезный
rtega_mnemonic:
懇懇RS
恳恳		sincere, earnest, cordial, social
  • sincerity has it's roots 貇 in the heart 心
  • ⓢ having a good 艮 heart 心
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 恳)
Pictophonetic: 貇 indicates the sound; 心 (heart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
懇求 [ kěn qiú ]: to beg; to beseech; to entreat; entreaty
懇切 [ kěn qiè ]: earnest; sincere
懇請 [ kěn qǐng ]: to request earnestly
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 貇 [ kūn ] to bite, to gnaw
    • 心 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
heisig_chinese_memo: The sociable skunk works wholeheartedly but there is another who works with even more heart, so he has a heart of silver.
koohiiStory1: The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love).
koohiiStory2: The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A badger, at the root of its heart, is a courteous creature.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: They may seem gruff and rude at first, but they'll still let you in their home in the middle of winter unannounced and offer you tea, a warm fire, and a place to sleep.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Badgers are especially courteous to condors (こん). Condors live in the trees while badgers live in burrows under those trees. When humans tear down the condor's homes, the badgers who live below them always let them stay over until they get back on their feet.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a courteous badger taking care of an injured, and now homeless, condor. It's fluffing the condor's pillows, bringing it soup, and patting it on the shoulder saying, "There, there."
Ru_Notes:
まごころ、誠意のこもった、手厚い、求める、という意味がある。
〔説文解字〕の本字は𢡆で〔説文・巻十・新附〕に「悃なり」とある。
Ru_Radicals: 犯 (преступник), 心 (сердце), 爪 (ноготь), 艮 (северо-восток), 豸 (барсук)
Ru_trainchinese:
kěn: (графема) искренний
kěn: (графема) умолять, просить (используется в многосложных словах)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the good badger's (貇) heart (心) offers friendship
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Giving a silver ring wholeheartedly means more than giving a diamond ring with only half a heart and external motives.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character form of "Xiaozhuan" starts from "心" with the sound of "豤". It is also called " Ken ", from the " heart " and the sound of " fish ". " Ken " is the same as " 𢡆 ". "Zhengzitong": "𢡆, the original word for earnest." The original meaning is sincere and sincere. "Shuowen Xinfu": "𢡆, sadness. From the heart, sound." Tang Dynasty Xuanying "All Jing Yinyi" volume four quoted "Popular Wen": "Sincere is sincere." Such as "Han Shu. Biography of the Ten Kings of Guangwu: "Then I will count Chen Qi, who remarked sincerely." "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Dong Er Yuan Liu Chuan": "Feng Ken admonishes, Shao anger is very angry, I think that it is a kind of weapon."

" Ken " also expresses a request. "Zhengzitong. Heart Department: "Encourage, vulgar borrowing to ask for meaning." Such as "Yuan Shi. "Yang Ren Chuan": "I beg for my relatives, and I got a hundred banknotes." Chapter 6 of "Jing Hua Yuan": "Besides, since Chang'e has been talking to me, I haven't said a word when we meet, so why should I beg him."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The character form of "Xiaozhuan" starts from "心" with the sound of "豤". It is also called " Ken ", from the " heart " and the sound of " fish ". " Ken " is the same as " 𢡆 ". The original meaning is sincere and sincere.
humanum_full_description:
小篆字形從「心」，「豤」聲。又作「懇」，從「心」，「貇」聲。「懇」同「𢡆」。《正字通》：「𢡆，懇本字。」本義是真誠、誠懇。《說文新附》：「𢡆，悃也。从心，豤聲。」唐代玄應《一切經音義》卷四引《通俗文》：「至誠曰懇。」如《後漢書．光武十王列傳》：「其後數陳乞，辭甚懇切。」《三國志．魏書．董二袁劉傳》：「豐懇諫，紹怒甚，以為沮眾，械繫之。」

　　「懇」亦表示請求。《正字通．心部》：「懇，俗借為干求意。」如《元史．羊仁傳》：「乃遍懇親故，貸得鈔百錠。」《鏡花緣》第6回：「況嫦娥自從與我角口，至今見面不交一言，我又何必懇他。」
humanum_short_description: 小篆字形從「心」，「豤」聲。又作「懇」，從「心」，「貇」聲。「懇」同「𢡆」。本義是真誠、誠懇。

小篆字形從「 心 」，「 豤 」聲。又作「 懇 」，從「 心 」，「 貇 」聲。「 懇 」同「 𢡆 」。《正字通》：「𢡆，懇本字。」本義是真誠、誠懇。《說文新附》：「𢡆，悃也。从心，豤聲。」唐代玄應《一切經音義》卷四引《通俗文》：「至誠曰懇。」如《後漢書．光武十王列傳》：「其後數陳乞，辭甚懇切。」《三國志．魏書．董二袁劉傳》：「豐懇諫，紹怒甚，以為沮眾，械繫之。」 「 懇 」亦表示請求。《正字通．心部》：「懇，俗借為干求意。」如《元史．羊仁傳》：「乃遍懇親故，貸得鈔百錠。」《鏡花緣》第6回：「況嫦娥自從與我角口，至今見面不交一言，我又何必懇他。」
Elaboration: The character form of "Xiaozhuan" starts from " 心" with the sound of " 豤". It is also called " Ken", from the " heart" and the sound of " fish". " Ken" is the same as " 𢡆". "Zhengzitong": "𢡆, the original word for earnest." The original meaning is sincere and sincere. "Shuowen Xinfu": "𢡆, sadness. From the heart, sound." Tang Dynasty Xuanying "All Jing Yinyi" volume four quoted "Popular Wen": "Sincere is sincere." Such as "Han Shu. Biography of the Ten Kings of Guangwu: "Then I will count Chen Qi, who remarked sincerely." "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Dong Er Yuan Liu Chuan": "Feng Ken admonishes, Shao anger is very angry, I think that it is a kind of weapon." " Ken" also expresses a request. "Zhengzitong. Heart Department: "Encourage, vulgar borrowing to ask for meaning." Such as "Yuan Shi. "Yang Ren Chuan": "I beg for my relatives, and I got a hundred banknotes." Chapter 6 of "Jing Hua Yuan": "Besides, since Chang'e has been talking to me, I haven't said a word when we meet, so why should I beg him."

懇字的基本解释

懇
kěn
见“恳”。

懇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kěn］
［《廣韻》康很切，上很，溪。］
“恳1”的繁体字。亦作“貇1”。亦作“1”。
(1)真诚，诚挚。
(2)请求；干求。

懇字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　懇； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页405第18
【唐韻】康很切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】口很切，?音墾。【說文】悃也。从心豤聲。本作?，今作懇。【集韻】誠也。【廣韻】懇惻，至誠也。又信也。　又或作貇。【前漢·劉向傳】貇貇數奸死亡之誅。【師古註】款誠之意。　亦作頎。【禮·檀弓】頎乎其至也。【註】頎音懇，惻隱之貌。又【周禮·冬官考工記】是故輈欲頎典。【註】頎典，堅刃貌。【鄭司農云】頎，讀爲懇。典，讀爲殄。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Ji 1] [Heart Word Department] 　 Ken; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: Page 405, 18
[Tang Yun] Kang is very cut [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] [Zheng Yun] The mouth is very cut,? Yinken. [Said the text] also worried. Sound from the heart. This for?, this for Ken. [Ji Yun] Cheng Ye. [Guang Yun] Sincere and sincere. You believe it.　Or as a catfish. [Previous Han·Liu Xiangzhuan] The death of a catfish who used to kill a catfish. [Shigu Note] The sincerity of the money.　 also make a slap. 【Ritual·Tan Gong】It's the best. [Note] Qi Yinken, compassionate appearance. Also [Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji] is a classic of obsessive desire. [Note] Qidian, strong blade appearance. [Zheng Sinongyun] Qi, pronounced as ken. Code, read as death.

kěn
вм. 恳
Radicals: 豸, 艮, 心  (badger, root, heart)
Meaning Mnemonic
A badger, at the root of its heart, is a courteous creature.
They may seem gruff and rude at first, but they'll still let you in their home in the middle of winter unannounced and offer you tea, a warm fire, and a place to sleep.
Reading Mnemonic
Badgers are especially courteous to condors (こん). Condors live in the trees while badgers live in burrows under those trees. When humans tear down the condor's homes, the badgers who live below them always let them stay over until they get back on their feet.
Picture a courteous badger taking care of an injured, and now homeless, condor. It's fluffing the condor's pillows, bringing it soup, and patting it on the shoulder saying, "There, there."

Examples: 懇ろ (ねんご.ろ)
犯 (преступник), 心 (сердце), 爪 (ноготь), 艮 (северо-восток), 豸 (барсук)
まごころ、誠意のこもった、手厚い、求める、という意味がある。
〔説文解字〕の本字は𢡆で〔説文・巻十・新附〕に「悃なり」とある。
